title: Highway Vehicles
content:
Highway Vehicles

State Regulations
§ 1225.40 - Vehicles so loaded, constructed, operated, equipped or maintained as to endanger persons or property, or to obstruct traffic barred from terminal
§ 1225.41 - Only vehicles in sound mechanical order and properly equipped permitted in terminal
§ 1225.42 - Operation of illegal vehicles prohibited
§ 1225.43 - Vehicle operators to be properly licensed
§ 1225.44 - Compliance with authorized traffic orders, signals, signs or directions required
§ 1225.45 - Operation of vehicles within terminal regulated
§ 1225.46 - Free-rolling vehicles prohibited
§ 1225.47 - Motors of vehicles parked in berths to be shut off; exceptions
§ 1225.48 - Use of parking areas conditioned upon payment of prescribed fees
§ 1225.49 - Parking restricted to designated places
§ 1225.50 - Repairs of vehicles in berth space, other than emergency, prohibited; exception
§ 1225.51 - Disabled vehicles subject to removal at operators risk and expense
§ 1225.52 - Drivers required in report accidents before leaving terminal
§ 1225.53 - Berth space may be cleared so as to permit closing of street side doors
§ 1225.54 - Removal of abandoned vehicles to be at owner's risk and expense

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
